data.title: Joe Jonas
data.meta_description: This article is about Joe Jonas. For the character with the same nickname, see Joe Lucas. data.text:
This article is about Joe Jonas. For the character with the same nickname, see Joe Lucas.

Joe Jonas is best known for being the leader and frontman of the Jonas Brothers, a band he started with his brothers Nick and Kevin. In recent years, they have had a guest appearance on Hannah Montana, playing themselves. However, one of their biggest acting performances to date was in the Disney Channel Original Movie, Camp Rock, where Joe himself played the male lead role, Shane Gray, opposite Demi Lovato.

He also appeared with his brothers in their own reality show, Living The Dream, which followed the band on their Look Me In The Eyes tour in 2008. The recent role on TV that he played was Joe Lucas on the show JONAS or after season 2 called, Jonas LA.

In 2019, Joe married Game Of Thrones star Sophie Turner and they have a daughter named Willa Jonas. Willa was born on July 22, 2020.

In 2020, Joe released his own TV show about travels called Cup Of Joe, available on Quibi.

In January 2021, it was announced that Joe would’ve taken part in a new big budget movie called Devotion as the third main character. It’s based on a real story narrated by Adam Makos in the Devotion book. In February 2021, they started filming it in Savannah, Georgia. Filming ends in April.
